metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12911 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebKitGTK+ 2.20.3 has an off-by-one error, with a resultant out-of-bounds write, in the get_simple_globs functions in ThirdParty/xdgmime/src/xdgmimecache.c and ThirdParty/xdgmime/src/xdgmimeglob.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.20.5-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.20.5-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.20.5-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.20.5-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.20.5-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.20.5-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.20.5-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.5-1').
